name: Donnie
story: Donnie was found dragging himself on the street with both back legs nonfunctional. He had nerve damage in one leg needing amputation, while the other atrophied from inactivity. With months of rehabilitation and a special wheelchair, he is now happy on three legs. He is incontinent, needs diapers, and can be startled by other dogs. He is however super friendly with humans, loves snuggles and is great with children.

name: Snowy
story: Snowy was rescued from a pagoda with severe mange and blood parasites that left him clinging to life. He has since made a full recovery, missing just a few teeth from old age. Being an older guy, he doesn't like to be disturbed during afternoon naps and needs a home that is calm and patient. If his future family has small children, they need to be gentle and respect his personal space.

name: Coco
story: Coco's previous owner decided to remain overseas, leaving her in the care of a flatmate facing housing challenges. Initially a bit shy and cautious, she forms close bonds with a select few and becomes a loyal companion once trust is established. She is smart and enjoys doing command training with student volunteers. Coco is best suited for a single-pet household with gentle, patient children.

name: Rex
story: Rex was discovered on the streets with E-canis, extreme malnutrition, and very severe demodex causing significant fur loss. He has since recovered, gained weight, his skin completely healed with a beautiful coat. Rex has a strong big-brother presence among dogs and is best suited for experienced owners able to manage the pack, or a single-pet household committed to continiuing his training. He enjoys cuddles from people he trusts and long outdoor strolls.

name: Li
story: Li arrived from a local shelter where she suffered from a severe skin condition, blood parasites, mange, painful cysts on her ovaries, and limited human interaction from being kept in a cage most days. Li is now healthy, happy, and pain-free. She's quiet and prefers light, gentle walks. While she does shed, grooming a few times a year keeps her looking her best. Li gets along well with dogs, and is best suited for a family with children who are patient and gentle.

name: Nick
story: Nick was rescued from the streets with a severe skin infection, ear mites, and a subsequent ear infection. Now fully recovered, he walks with a touch of swagger that earns him the nickname Lil' Nick at the shelter. As a street-smart dog who communicates through body language and can be a bit snappy when he needs space, Nick thrives with experienced dog owners who can provide further training.

name: Clover
story: Clover was born on 31st December 2022 in the care of Laws for Paws after her pregnant mom was rescued. She's small with a long body and adorable short legs, making her ideal for apartment life. She's playful and sweet, although requires a bit of time to form new bonds. As a young pup, she benefits from continued training and cannot be left alone for long periods of time.

name: Sandy
story: Sandy was rescued from a motorbike mechanic shop in Thao Dien, battling severe demodex and a broken leg. She has since recovered well, with her fur slowly growing back and regaining her trust in humans. Despite a permanent limp on her back leg, she is pain-free and loves walks. She is a bit nervous at first but becomes your shadow once trust is established. She's best suited for a household with gentle, patient children.

name: Kiki
story: Kiki was found wandering the streets with a gaping wound on her neck. After regular cleaning and a few stitches, she has since made a full recovery and is now healthy and happy. Being an older girl with challenges to her back legs, Kiki finds joy in short, slow walks and indulges in long daytime naps. She is easily frustrated by young dogs, but relishes attention from humans, is always happy for snuggles, and gets along well with cats.

name: Pinkie
story: Pinkie's mother was abandoned at a construction site where the workers had left her locked inside. As the last of her litter, Pinkie has faced challenges in finding a home, possibly due to her reserved nature. Despite being overlooked, Pinkie is an incredibly gentle, easy-going, friendly dog who loves cuddles. She would make the perfect companion for nearly any household, getting along with both children and other dogs.

name: Daisy
story: Daisy's previous owner faced unforeseen health problems and had to urgently return to their home country. She was taken into the care of Laws for Paws, ensuring she wouldn't be used for breeding. She's cautious at first but quickly becomes attached to people. Due to some separation anxiety, she prefers not to be left alone for long periods of time. An ideal match for Daisy would be someone who works from home or a household with other dogs, providing her with lots of companionship.

name: Bobo
story: Bobo came from another shelter with too many dogs to care for. She is deaf and easily startled, making her more cautious around new people. She thrives in a calm home and is best suited for an older couple, or patient owners dedicated to building a strong bond. She is very loving and affectionate once comfortable, and enjoys leisurely walks followed by cozy naps. Her small size makes her a perfect fit for apartment living.

name: Shenzi
story: Shenzi was discovered on the streets of Hoc Mon in extreme heat, with severe skin infection, barely any hair on her body, and a deformed front paw that turned out to be a birth defect. She is smart, friendly, and adaptable. She has embraced life with three legs and enjoys playing with other dogs. While needing some time to warm up to people, she becomes a loyal and loving companion once she has learned to trust you.

name: Cloud
story: Cloud was found wandering the streets with a completely broken jaw. After surgery and receiving round-the-clock care, he has made a full recovery despite missing some teeth. He is very small, sweet, easy-going, and possesses a gentle nature that makes him perfect for apartment dwellers seeking a loving companion. He enjoys long naps in a sunny spot and lots of cuddles. If his future home has children, they need to be gentle due to his small size.

name: Flour
story: Flour and her brother belonged to scrap collectors too busy to take care of them, leaving the puppies to wander by themselves. She is a bit shy at first, but has adapted well to humans from her successful stay with fosters. She's friendly, affectionate, playful, and enjoys playing with toys. Her bigger size is balanced by her incredibly gentle nature, making her a perfect fit for homes with children.

name: Mua
story: Mua was found abandoned on the streets on a rainy night, inspiring her name Mua (meaning “rain” in Vietnamese). She had luxating patella on her back knees, which has now been fixed, allowing her to play and run normally. She is very cuddly, loves being around and sleeping next to you, yet showing no sign of separation anxiety so far. She's small, perfect for apartment life, gets along well with other dogs, and has a special affinity for children. She would benefit from continued daily training.

name: Caspy
story: Caspy and his brother endured a difficult start, losing his mother at birth, suffering from dehydration due to being fed sugared cow milk, and severe tick and worm infestations. He has defied all odds to make a full recovery. As a puppy he is friendly and playful, needs continued training and plenty of love and companionship. He cannot be left alone for long periods of time, making his forever family's commitment crucial.

name: Suma
story: Suma has overcome tremendous odds in his young life, losing his mother at birth, battling severe dehydration and tick and worm infestations that left his survival uncertain. He has made a full recovery and is now a healthy, playful puppy. He requires patience, training, and lots of love. As puppy he thrives on companionship and should not be left alone for long periods of time, making a committed forever family essential.
